summary: This is a simple PowerShell script that monitors the game's papyrus log file, and alerts the user if there are stack dumps present.
descriptionHtml:
[b][size=4]Brief[/size][/b]
This is a simple PowerShell script that monitors the papyrus log file, and alerts the user if there are stack dumps present.

[b][size=4]Overview[/size][/b]
When running lots of mods -- especially script intensive mods -- there is a
risk of the  scripting engine becoming overloaded. If the number of
active scripts exceeds a certain threshold, they will be [b]dumped[/b], which means that they are written out the logfile. Some scripts may get suspended as the Papyrus engine tries to recover.

This [i]can[/i] be a sign that something has gone very wrong. So I wrote this monitor script to alert me.

[b][size=4]Results
[/size][/b]During normal gameplay, the output of the monitor will look something like this. Note that having [i]some[/i] errors and warnings is quite normal if you have mods installed.
[quote]---------------------------------------------------------------------------
[code][/code][code]LOG SIZE           : 27.60 KB
NUMBER OF DUMPS    : 0
NUMBER OF STACKS   : 0
AVG STACKS/DUMP    : 0
NUMBER OF WARNINGS : 87
NUMBER OF ERRORS   : 33[/code][/quote]
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
When a stack dump has occurred, the output of the monitor will look like
this. It will be accompanied by a beeping sound every 4 seconds and the
PowerShell window changing color.
[quote]---------------------------------------------------------------------------
[code]LOG SIZE           : 948.92 KB
NUMBER OF DUMPS    : 1
NUMBER OF STACKS   : 118
AVG STACKS/DUMP    : 118
NUMBER OF WARNINGS : 392
NUMBER OF ERRORS   : 1246
[06/04/2018 - 11:50:23PM] Count of suspended stacks is over our warning threshold, dumping stacks:
[/code][/quote]
author: MarkDF
